definition[0]: a forceful person expresses their opinions very strongly and clearly and people are easily persuaded by them
example[0]: He gained a reputation as a forceful member of the party.
definition[1]: forceful arguments, reasons etc are strongly and clearly expressed
example[1]: a forceful attack on government policy
definition[2]: having a powerful effect that is likely to change a situation
example[2]: The president hasnâ€™t been forceful enough in changing the judicial system.
example[3]: Governments should adopt a more forceful approach to improve the environment.
